That‚Äôs why this year, 2020, we need to plan for 2030 and 2040. We need to seize the opportunities that exist so that years from now, the next generation of Iowans will inherit an Iowa whose greatness comes as no surprise to anyone.#OpportunityLivesHere https://t.co/cX6IpQ7K2x

Let‚Äôs seize this opportunity and make the next decade Iowa‚Äôs best.
So as we move into the next decade, let‚Äôs put Iowans first. Let‚Äôs be bold and visionary.
As we head into this legislative session, let‚Äôs not focus solely on the next 12 months. This is a time to chart the path for the next ten years. #OpportunityLivesHere

#OpportunityLivesHere because of the ingenuity of our people. If IA is going to thrive in the next decade, we must make sure that government isn‚Äôt stifling that ingenuity. It's been far too long since we‚Äôve modernized our licensing structure. That‚Äôs what I‚Äôm calling for today.
Together, we can help put returning citizens on a path to redemption. We can help them become productive members of society, reduce recidivism, and make our communities a safer place.
You can‚Äôt imagine the gratitude and dignity that Iowans feel when they‚Äôre told they can once again exercise what Ronald Reagan called ‚Äúthe crown jewel of American liberties.‚Äù
I am renewing my support to amend our Constitution so that it no longer bars felons from voting after they‚Äôve served their sentence. #OpportunityLivesHere
But it‚Äôs more than that. When someone has lost their way, we‚Äôre called to seek them out‚Äîto leave the 99 to find the one. I believe in that calling...
Those in our correctional facilities are serving time for a reason, but when they leave, we want them to succeed.

I‚Äôve made it a priority of this administration to focus on prisoner re-entry and rehabilitation, because our prisons shouldn‚Äôt be one stop in a circle that leads back to prison. #OpportunityLivesHere

Childcare is the next workforce issue we need to tackle. It‚Äôs another barrier for families looking for a way up. For some, it‚Äôs about affordability; for others, access is the issue; and for thousands of Iowans, it‚Äôs both. This year we need to act. #OpportunityLivesHere
@futurereadyiowa @FutureReadyIowa will infuse Iowa‚Äôs workforce with thousands of skilled employees, providing much needed support to our growing businesses.
@futurereadyiowa Over 6,000 Iowans are already receiving the Last Dollar Scholarship, almost 80 percent of which are adult learners. That‚Äôs 6,000 Iowans who are on their way to a rewarding career.
@futurereadyiowa Iowans who are looking for a way up are finding that opportunity.
When it comes to workforce opportunities, Iowa is in a strong position. We have thousands of open jobs in rewarding careers. That‚Äôs why we launched @FutureReadyIowa. #OpportunityLivesHere
The budget I‚Äôm presenting to you today makes another historic investment, with over $103 million in new funding so that Iowa schools can maintain the best teachers and classrooms in the world.
In 2019, we made historic investments in K-12 education, with over $90 million in new money, including an increase in per-pupil funding and transportation equity. #OpportunityLivesHere

In the last year alone, we‚Äôve expanded high-school registered apprenticeships and launched the work-based learning clearinghouse, and this year will be adding $1 million for work-based learning coordinators to be covered by operational-sharing agreements.
One of the best ways for students to learn is through hands-on experience, which is why we‚Äôre making Iowa a leader in work-based learning.
I‚Äôm calling on the Legislature to take computer science statewide and ensure every student, at every level, has access to this new basic skill.
If there‚Äôs something Iowans have always understood, it‚Äôs that there is no better path to opportunity than a quality education. #OpportunityLivesHere

Today, I‚Äôm requesting that we appropriate an additional $15 million and adjust our state match so we can continue to leverage private and federal funding to build out broadband to every part of Iowa. #OpportunityLivesHere

I‚Äôve also directed DHS to remove barriers that are restricting schools from partnering with telehealth providers... What used to be a 70-mile drive in the middle of the school day can now be a walk down the hall.
That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm taking steps to increase the number of doctors who are willing and able to provide OB services in all four corners of our state.
We must also do more to promote and support maternal health. Fewer doctors and fewer hospitals are delivering babies and providing care for mothers, especially outside our urban areas.
And when I say all stages of life, I mean to include the unborn. We must protect life by making clear, through an amendment, that our constitution does not grant a right to abortion.
As we move into 2020, I‚Äôm focused on the overall wellness of all Iowans, in every part of the State, in all stages of life.  #OpportunityLivesHere

If we take this bold step, right now, then whoever is standing at this podium in 10, 20, or 30 years‚ÄîRepublican or Democrat‚Äîcan proudly say what I can say today: The condition of our State is strong.
The #InvestinIowaAct will bring meaningful change to Iowans in the very first year. But most important, it looks to the future. To our children and theirs.
I‚Äôm also proposing, through the #InvestinIowaAct, that we reduce property tax levies and provide the needed mental health funding through the State general fund.
I‚Äôm proposing to cut income taxes by an additional 10% for almost every Iowan, with lower-income Iowans receiving as much as a 25% cut next year.

I have no interest in raising taxes, so any increase in revenue from a sales tax must be more than offset by additional tax cuts. That starts with continuing to reduce our uncompetitive income-tax rates.
These changes will make our vision a reality. It‚Äôs an investment in our future. And it‚Äôs an investment in those who are our future.

I will introduce the Invest in Iowa Act, a bill that will. significantly cut income taxes, create a sustainable funding source for our mental health system, reduce the burden of property taxpayers, and fund the Natural Resources and Outdoor Recreation Trust. #OpportunityLivesHere
That kind of planning takes a bold vision. A vision that preserves our heritage while seizing opportunities.

That‚Äôs why this year, 2020, we need to plan for 2030 and 2040. We need to seize the opportunities that exist so that years from now, the next generation of Iowans will inherit an Iowa whose greatness comes as no surprise to anyone.
But we cannot take anything for granted. We cannot become complacent...

Our unemployment rate has gone from a near-record high to a record low. Instead of cutting school budgets, we‚Äôre cutting taxes. Our cash reserves are full, wages are going up, and Iowans once again believe we‚Äôre headed in the right direction.

The Condition of the State is Strong: 

2020 marks the beginning of a new decade, so it‚Äôs appropriate that we take stock in what we‚Äôve accomplished in the last 10 years. But also talk about what we want for the next 10 - and beyond. #OpportunityLivesHere

This morning I deliver my Condition of the State Address, laying out a vision for 2020 and the decade to come. #OpportunityLivesHere
